title: Query ws for actual address bound to when listening
body:
This PR uses a newer version of `ws` in my fork of that repo. I suggest first updating https://github.com/tomusdrw/ws-rs to the code at https://github.com/faern/ws-rs/tree/arbitrary-handshake-responses. Then this PR does not have to change the dependency any longer and I can remove that commit. So that this repo never have to depend on my fork.

Other than than this PR uses the new `WebSocket::local_addr` method to query which `SocketAddr` we were actually bound to. Thus making it possible to find out which port was chosen if one bind to port `0` to get a random one.

title: WS pubsub example.
body:
- Exposing `futures::sync::mpsc::Sender` in `RequestContext`
- Apparently `ws::Sender` doesn't track if the connection is still active so I've added manual tracking and exposed it in `RequestContext`.
- Updates all examples to avoid glob imports (only `jsonrpc_core` is imported with a wildcard)

Closes: #120

title: Support multiple hyper threads.
body:
Closes #102 

Benchmarks:
- 1 thread: 21,374 req/s
- 4 threads 75,751 req/s

title: Use latest hyper (master)
body:
Implements `jsonrpc-http-sever` using future-based `master` branch of `hyper`.
Related #91 

Also fixes couple of TODOs (unecessary Boxing in minihttp and `io::Error`s propagation)

Performance stats (example `server`, compiled in `--release`)
1. Old http: 2.157 req/s
2. New http: 23.456 req/s
3. Mini http (threads=1): 33.822 req/s

title: Impl Error trait on http server Error types
body: Implementing the standard `Error` trait for the error returned by `ServerBuilder::start_http` making it more ergonomic to handle. For example makes it easy to just `.chain_err(...)` when using the `error_chain` crate

body:
- Unify http and minihttp APIs
- Add `control` to HttpMiddleware

title: Backport: Allow requests when Origin and Host match. (#78)
Allow requests when Origin and Host match.
body:
`Origin` header is included in POST request even if `<Origin> = http://<Host>`, so the response can be read without CORS headers (cause it's not CORS request).
This PR allows such requests to be processed.

title: Fix for clean shutdown on windows
Continue on invalid CORS
body: Required by Parity to properly support requests sent by Parity-Extension (it includes `Origin:null` although is able to read the response even if CORS headers are not returned)

title: Improving error message for invalid parameters.
Don't process invalid CORS requests
body:
Closes #62 

Also returns correct headers for OPTIONS requests.
